summary: The Fed Integrity and Independence Act of 2025 aims to reinforce the independence of the Federal Reserve System. It prohibits individuals appointed by the President from simultaneously holding positions on the Board of Governors, as well as the positions of Federal Reserve Bank Presidents and the First Vice President of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, including those on leave of absence from other roles. The bill also includes provisions for individuals holding these positions at the time of enactment to address ineligibility due to these changes.
